log.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a thick piece of wood from a tree
log.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: an official record of events, especially on a journey in a ship or plane
log.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: The captain always keeps a log.
log.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to make an official record of events, facts etc
log.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to travel a particular distance or for a particular length of time, especially in a plane or ship
log.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: The pilot has logged 1,200 flying hours.
log.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: to make a record of each time that something happens
log.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: The new system logs every call that a customer makes to the company.
log.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: to change by a particular amount
log.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: The Consumer Price Index could log a gain of 0.5% in August.
log.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: an official detailed record of something
log.translation[3].definitions[0].exampl: Keep a detailed log of telephone calls.
